summary: Gerald P Hamilton was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list Hamilton's name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for specific accounting periods. The documents do not provide specific details about Hamilton's role within the HSCA, but they confirm his employment during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Gerald P Hamilton's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll and certification reports indicates his involvement in the committee's operations.
